item.title: Newest runescape client at your website
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

you do have to sign the jar because if it works correctly, it would connect to a server which is not the applet’s codebase, this is stopped by the applet security manager, so new Socket(String, int) would throw a java.lang.SecurityException

or what you could do, is have it connect to your own server, the codebase, and make a simple tunneler application which redirects everything to jagex’s server, it might not work though cause of the measures which stop packet editing bots, so im not really sure about that

why dont you just make your own loader if you’re so bent on loading the applet outside the offical website

Read full topic

item.title: Newest runescape client at your website
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

phevos:

and can someone tell me how to connect with the latest runescape deop connect to runescape update server

open client.java, look in main(String[]), somewhere around the bottom, there is something like Class25.aString455 = “127.0.0.1”;
change the 127.0.0.1 bit to “jolt1.runescape.com” or whichever server you want to connect to, then run the client as an application

about the rest of your post, i dont think it would work, cause when running as an applet, it gets the connect server from getCodeBase(), so it would try to connect to whatever your website is
also, you cant mix deob files and normal files, because they are refactorised names, so the normal files look for Rg.f, but the deob only has Class5.anIntArray565. you could do all that with bcel if you wanted to

good try though

Read full topic
item.source: Newest runescape client at your website

item.title: Newest runescape client at your website
item.dc:creator: @phevos phevos
item.description:
@phevos wrote:

You will need Winrar and Wamp

First you need to Deopfuscate the newest runescape
so when you have all the Java files open Applet_Sub1 with notepad
search for this:

public boolean method25(int i) { int i_14_ = 120 % ((i - -8) / 61); String string = getDocumentBase().getHost().toLowerCase(); anInt6++; if (string.equals("jagex.com") || string.endsWith(".jagex.com")) return true; if (string.equals("127.0.0.1") || string.endsWith(".runescape.com)) return true; if (string.endsWith("127.0.0.1")) return true; for (/**/; ((string.length() ^ 0xffffffff) < -1 && string.charAt(string.length() - 1) >= '0' && string.charAt(string.length() + -1) <= '9'); string = string.substring(0, string.length() - 1)) { /* empty */ } if (string.endsWith("192.168.1.")) return true; method23(-29434, "invalidhost"); return false;
Change it with this and save

public boolean method25(int i) { int i_14_ = 120 % ((i - -8) / 61); String string = getDocumentBase().getHost().toLowerCase(); anInt6++; if (string.equals("jagex.com") || string.endsWith(".jagex.com")) return true; if (string.startsWith("127.0.0.1")) return true; for (/**/; ((string.length() ^ 0xffffffff) < -1 && string.charAt(string.length() - 1) >= '0' && string.charAt(string.length() + -1) <= '9'); string = string.substring(0, string.length() - 1)) { /* empty */ } if (string.endsWith("192.168.1.")) return true; method23(-29434, "invalidhost"); return false;
now the client wont “invalidhost” when you lauch it in the webbrowser

Compile all the .java files
now open the opfuscated runescape.jar with winrar and delete al the class files but not the dir META-Inf
copy al the new class files to the runescape.jar
now close winrar
Open the wamp install folder and go to the dir www copy the runescape.jar in it
now open notepad and copy this text into it

<applet name="app" width="765" height="503" archive="runescape.jar" code="client"> <param name="game" value="0"> <param name="js" value="1"> <param name="lang" value="0"> <param name="lowmem" value="1"> <param name="members" value="0"> <param name="modewhat" value="0"> <param name="modewhere" value="0"> <param name="plug" value="2"> <param name="worldid" value="1"> </applet>
save it into the wamp www dir as index.htm
you can start wamp and go to http://127.0.0.1 and you will see the runescape applet

sorry foir my bad english but iam not english
if something is wrong please correct me

and can someone tell me how to connect with the latest runescape deop connect to runescape update server

Read full topic
